newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-HOWLEY AND TOWNSEND TO ADVANCE TEST CLAIMS.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-HOWLEY AND TOWNSEND TO ADVANCE TEST CLAIMS.

text.p: Rob Howley and Gregor Townsend have a golden opportunity to advance their claims as the halfback combination for the test series when the British Lions open their South African tour in Port Elizabeth on Saturday.

Welsh scrumhalf Howley and Scotland flyhalf Townsend will be dictating tactics in a near test-strength back line when the Lions take on an Eastern Province invitation side at the Boet Erasmus stadium.

Of the seven three-quarters on show in Port Elizabeth, fullback Neil Jenkins, centres Scott Gibbs and Jeremy Guscott and the halfback pairing are all likely candidates for the Lions test match line-up.

The classy Howley, one of the star players in this year's Five Nations championship, is a virtual certainty for the Lions test team and his scrumhalf duel with Springbok Joost van der Westhuizen is expected to be one of the highlights of the series.

The gifted Townsend, occasionally prone to glaring errors, is celebrating his return to stand-off after spending most of the last two seasons at either inside or outside centre for both club and country.
"I've been playing all of my recent rugby at inside centre and that isn't my favourite position. Getting back to stand-off is just great," Townsend said.

The 24-year-old Townsend is certainly keen to secure the flyhalf berth for the tests. "That's the ultimate aim and that's why everyone is here -- we all want to get into the test team and to win the series against South Africa," he said. "Saturday's game is very important for the whole tour -- it's against untested opposition in unknown territory."
Lions coach Ian McGeechan, who also coaches Townsend's club Northampton, will be watching his halfback combination on Saturday with particular interest.
"Obviously, it's important that he (Townsend) settles into it and that we get a good halfback relationship going. It's vital too that Gregor manages the game well.
"We've been working a lot on the options of the other players and Gregor has a role to play in that."
